subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] A small note on the Unicode proposal
msgSnippet: The 375 mapping is okay, but the unicode mapping pdf in the resources directory is further along (and better imho). You make a very good point about the
messageBody:
The 375 mapping is okay, but the unicode mapping pdf in the resources
directory is further along (and better imho).

You make a very good point about the underlined numbers, we either have
to create code points for underlined digits or an underline combining char.
The first will cost 3 bytes per digit and need 10 code points (obviously :).
The second will cost 4 bytes per digit but will only take one code point
and would allow other chars to be underlined - such as the commas in
1,000,000.
Neither system would allow the digits to be properly parsed as numbers
by legacy programs though.

tim_rice09 wrote:
>
> Progress is being made
>
> See message #375, it has a very good plan for a Unicode proposal
> for Senior Quickscript. Although it is missing one character, the
> modified Roe that follows Eat and Ooze.
> Another thing, numbers written in Senior Quickscript are by default
> underlined. Writing them in the underlined style will not work in
> basic word processors like Notepad.
>
>
